Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of immigration officer's decision on PRRA and H&C applications
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants entered Canada with forged passports and claimed refugee status due to alleged domestic violence
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimants seeking PRRA and H&C relief
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of evidence and sufficiency of new documentation
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Post-refusal applications for PRRA and H&C consideration
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Prior credibility issues affected weight of new evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Affidavits, medical reports, country condition reports
Crimes.Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to domestic violence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Equivocal affidavits and unverified medical documents
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Permanent resident status on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Applicants must provide credible evidence for PRRA and H&C claims under IRPA
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of objective, verifiable evidence supporting risk claims
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk from ex-spouse in Nigeria
Crimes.Cause_Description: Fled Nigeria due to domestic violence, used forged passports to enter Canada
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: New evidence deemed insufficient due to lack of corroboration
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Unverified, self-serving affidavits without independent support
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Unauthorized entry and stay in Canada
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: False travel documents at point of entry
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Section 25(1) – H&C discretion; Section 112 – PRRA requirements
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer required objective proof given prior credibility concerns
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Insufficient credible evidence to establish risk or hardship
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to meet evidentiary burden despite opportunity to submit new evidence
